thread.title: 'I'll criticise judges' says Donald Trump hours after supreme court nominee's criticims
thread.title_full: 'I'll criticise judges' says Donald Trump hours after supreme court nominee's criticims

author: Chiara Palazzo
title: 'I'll criticise judges' says Donald Trump hours after supreme court nominee's criticims

organizations.name: national republican congressional committee march dinner

text:
'I'll criticise judges' says Donald Trump hours after supreme court nominee's criticims Donald Trump speaks at the National Republican Congressional Committee March Dinner in Washington DC Credit: Getty Images Chiara Palazzo , video source APTN 22 March 2017 • 6:13am 
D onald Trump was adamant that he'd keep on criticising judges hours after his supreme court nominee told the senate that he was “disheartened” and "demoralised" by attacks on the judiciary branch, including by the US president, on Tuesday. 
"The courts are not helping us, I have to be honest with you," Mr Trump said in a speech before the National Republican Congressional Committee. "It's ridiculous. Somebody said I should not criticise judges. Okay, I'll criticise judges." 
Mr Trump referenced a controversy that he has been embroiled in: his efforts to suspend temporarily people travelling from seven Muslim-majority nations. Watch | Donald Trump claims appellate court ruling is 'political' 00:48 
"I'll criticise judges to keep criminals and terrorists the hell out of our country, said Mr Trump." 
H is original January 27 executive order applying to people from Syria, Sudan, Libya, Somalia, Yemen, Iraq and Iran was blocked by federal judges. A subsequent rewritten version has been blocked as well. Just cannot believe a judge would put our country in such peril. If something happens blame him and court system. People pouring in. Bad! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) 5 February 2017 
A t his Senate confirmation hearing hours earlier, Neil Gorsuch was asked about Mr Trump's attacks on the judiciary branch which included calling a Seattle judge who blocked his immigration and travel ban a "so-called judge" and claiming that judges were to be "given blame if an act of terror occurred. " Watch | Neil Gorsuch: Donald Trump's attacks on federal judges 'disheartening' and 'demoralising' 00:30 
"When anyone criticises the honesty, integrity, the motives of a federal judge, I find that disheartening, I find that demoralising, because I know the truth," Mr Gorsuch, a Colorado-based judge, said. 
W hen asked by Richard Blumenthal, a Democratic senator, whether "anyone" included the president, Mr Gorsuch replied: "Anyone is anyone."
